alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 5:06PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Johnson, northern Floyd, northeastern Breathitt, Magoffin and east central Wolfe Counties through 545 PM EST... At 503 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mountain Valley, or 9 miles northeast of Jackson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Foraker, Hendricks, Fritz, Gullett and Lambric around 510 PM EST. Salyersville, Mason, Conley Station, Carver, Sublett, Skaggs, Carver Station, Tiptop, Lakesville and Duco around 515 PM EST. Marshallville, Swampton, Gypsy, Royalton, West Royalton Station, Ivyton, Bradley, Gapville, Burning Fork and Fredville around 520 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Brainard, Riceville, Swamp Branch, Dobson, Ballot, Orchard, Pyramid, Bonanza, Dotson, Dock, Blue River, East Point, Leander, Patrick, Denver, Collista, Fitz, Prestonsburg, Martin, Allen, Lancer, Cliff, Bays Branch, Auxier, Emma, Nero, Dwale, Dicks Creek, Corn Fork Hollow, Alvin, Odds and Ivel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
